maqras.text: Praise the limitless glory of your Lord's name, the Most High
Who created and proportioned
Who destined and [then] guided
He who brought out the green pasture
and then made it black stubble
We will make you recite, and you will not forget
except what God wills. He knows what is open to one's perception and what is hidden
And We will ease you toward the easy way
So, remind, if reminding helps
He who fears God will remember
But the most wicked will ignore it
He will kindle the greatest fire
where he will remain, neither dying nor living
Successful is he who purifies himself
and remembers to call on his Lord and pray
But you prefer this worldly life
whereas the Hereafter is better and more enduring
All this is can be found in the earlier Scriptures
the Scriptures of Abraham and Moses
Have you heard about the Overwhelming Event
Some faces, that Day, will be humbled
working hard and exhausted
They will kindle an intensely hot Fire
and will be given drinks from a boiling spring
They will have no food except from a thorny plant
that neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger
Other faces, that day, will be peaceful
Well pleased with their endeavor
in an elevated Garden
where they will hear no idle talk
A flowing spring runs through it
Raised couches are placed there
cups put in place
cushions lined up
and carpets spread around
Don't they look at how the camels are created
at how the sky is raised
at how the mountains are erected
and at how the earth is spread out
So remind them, for you are but a reminder
You are not in control of them
But whoever turns away and rejects the truth
God will inflict him with the greatest punishment
To Us is their return
Then it is for Us to call them to account
By the daybreak
and by ten nights
by the even and the odd
and by the night as it recedes
is there not in [all] that an oath for a rational person
Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with Aad
with Iram of the pillars
whose like was never created in any land
with Thamud, those who carved the rocks in the valley
And with Pharaoh, of the stakes
All of them committed excesses in the lands
and spread much corruption there
So your Lord poured on them a scourge of punishment
Your Lord is always watchful
As for human being, whenever his Lord tests him, by honoring him, and blessing him, he says, "My Lord has honored me
But when He tries him, and restricts his provision for him, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me
Not at all! It is you who are not generous with the orphans
and you do not urge one another to feed the needy
you who devour the inheritance [of others] with obvious greed
and you who passionately love wealth
No indeed! When the earth is crushed, pounded and crushed
and your Lord comes with the angels, row after row
on that Day, Hell will be brought near. On that Day, the human being will remember, but what good will that be to him then
He will say, "I wish I had provided for this life to come
On that Day, none will punish as He punishes
And none will shackle as severely as He shackles
[To the righteous it will be said], "Tranquil soul
Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him]
go in among My worshipers
and into My Garden
